title: I don't understand people asking for Aatrox buffs.
body: I can agree he needs a rework, but seriously isn't his drain tank status something Riot hates the fuck out of and makes him a balance nightmare? My heart goes to Aatrox players and his spots in the meta, but I really don't think they can just buff him and expect Aatrox to come out okay without requiring heavy changes to his kit.

Darius, Fiora (without lifesteal on items), Illaoi, Irelia, Xin, Vladimir(?), it's not drain tanking. Their healing is independent of the damage they deal, which means it's possible to tune both damage and healing separately, and you don't have the core issue of drain tanking, that is if you are ahead, you build more damage, kill more people AND are unkillable because you ALSO boosted your healing by building damage.

Olaf, Nasus and Warwick are actually drain tanks, but Nasus his kept in check by his need to stack, and Warwick is currently reworked. That leaves only Olaf, which isn't so many champions that it's a convincing proof.

Riven isn't a Drain Tank, but she does have a shield scaling with AD, so it's a related issue, even if not exactly the same. But the fact it's a *shield* and not a *heal* makes it less of a problem, by far. You need to time it right, etc.

Graves and every ADC lategame, well, ADC are supposed to be the dominant class lategame, and they need to work to reach this state. Plus, they are so squishy that they can't 1v5 like Nasus or Olaf or Aatrox if he was buffed.

EDIT: I checked for Vlad, most of his healing scales with AP/damage, but he was reworked recently precisely to make sure he was healthier than before. So I should have put him in the same category as Warwick, not with Darius and co., but it's still not a convincing proof.

Darius, Illaoi, Olaf, Vladimir, Graves, Xin, Swain

Just all the top of my head, all viable drain tanks who currently function far better. You can buy executioner for these champions and hurt them, but they would all be able to somewhat function.

But for Aatrox, if you buy executioner? He's fucked. Plain and simple. 

I don't understand how people say his kit is unbalanceable and toxic. Its not, people talk about how he's feast or famine as if he's the only champion who suffers from that issue, but yet other feast or famine champions regularly see attention, Christ sakes, Riven is about to get a huge buff onto her ultimate, Xin Zhao literally can 1v5 if he snowballs and got an added buff of being able to crit on his 3rd strike.

Why is it suddenly with Aatrox, who doesn't even have an alarming amount of life steal built into his kit like some of these other champions, which fun fact, by the time the double lifesteal kicks in due to low health, you usually can inflict the grevious wounds onto him by then, the reaction is OH GOD NO. 

He inherently drain tanks the least amount of every drain tank there is. At the least, you could throw a bone Aatrox's way, make his knock-up radius slightly larger, make his flight uninterruptible, give his E better base damage late game. 

There are many ways to buff Aatrox without breaking him that would just simply make him feel better to play as. 

Fuck sakes, Graves isn't even a designated drain tank and he does the job better than Aatrox does.

If they buff anything on Aatrox I think it should possibly be his W in damage form as while it deals decent damage it also hurts Aatrox a lot and he doesn't get any healing at all (All of his abilities damage himself except W so disabling the only form of healing that makes up for taking so much damage better be worth it... and I don't think it is most of the time)

Well I guess it is worth it when above 50% health mostly because the healing isn't all that good then...
but it might not be great even then? 
Rank 1 you deal 60 + 100% bonus AD extra damage (before armor) however you lose out on 35 + 50% Bonus AD (hp cost + heal)
Rank 5 you deal 200 + 100% bonus AD extra damage however lose out on 90 + 50% bonus AD

So if the enemy has around 100 armor the extra damage dealt is about the same as the healing "lost" and the health cost... at higher armor the damage will be lower compared with the loss of health

Of course you would always have the damage on if you are winning and just want to kill your opponent fast (after all then taking some damage and not getting healed doesn't really matter)

I think the toggle is definitely the big issue here, the health he loses for the damage he deals simply isn't worth it for probably 80% of all situations that an Aatrox might be in.

However drain tank balance is difficult to do, so I'd rather stay away from touching his toggle in the meantime less it causes a big oops and focus on the short term fix. That would probably involve looking at his gap closer/knock up and his E to give him something.

The problem with his toggle is it is VERY reliant on both AD and AS to do anything and BoRK and Trinity are (iirc) the only 2 items in the game that give both (and both give "meh" AD). His W healing is super mediocre and he goes even almost with Irelia W (78 VS 40 + 0.25 bonus AD every third or 120 + 0.75 below half) while being worse in almost every other conceivable way. 

Aatrox simply gets outclassed by every other champion in his class. He is quite literally worse Xin Zhao. Worse gap closer (can be used more freely but screams "pls interrupt me" whereas Xin's is instant). Both have knock ups, however, Xin's is not situational neither is Xin's slow. Xin uses mana (kinda) whereas Aatrox kills himself. Xin gets both parts of Aatrox W passively. Xin shreds armor and has a defensive steroid+knock back. What does Aatrox have? Slightly longer AA range during ult, a meh revive, and his AS is tied to a full blood well and using ult whereas Xin simply hits W. Basically, Aatrox does less than Xin and has to work twice as hard since he has skill shots and a toggle to manage.

There is a reason Riot contemplated doing Divers next, because, like assassins, it is entirely based on "who does the job best?" because all their kits are too damn similar so there is very little to differentiate them besides who does more damage throughout a fight consistently (and can live the fight which are both of Aatrox's problems).
